Reviews.Title: A good product !
Reviews.Author: R. Williams
Reviews.Content: I waited a few months after purchasing this tv, before attempting a review.MY experiences/opinions are (scale of 1-10, 10 being the best):Handling, ability to move to desired location:  10 ... light, easy for 1 person to move,maneuver, install on standEasiness to initially setup/get useful asap:  10 ... You really do NOT need the directions, but they are excellentConnections amount,availability, setup:  10 ... I have cable, a PS3, and Xbox360, dvd ... too easy if you ask  me !Viewing: 9  ... great from even extreme angles. Adjustments in the menu DO fine tune your individual needs.  : the 1080P shines in action movies, sports, and especially video games ... resolution is phenomenal !  : I've experienced NO bleeding of colors or blurriness in high speed transitionsAudio: 7 ... OK at best, but I bought it for its viewing capabilities, NOT expecting a 'Bose' audio capacity.  One of its menu items allows you to keep advertising volumes the same as network broadcast volumes...  Mine does NOT function that way... commercials still too loud  I have it (easily connected to) enhanced by my stereo system, so this is a wash as far as I am concerned  when wanting to listen to a Nascar race, music concert, or other venue.Price: I did a LOT of homework, and found the price very acceptable in comparison to other tv's boasting  similar if not identical capabilities... I bought mine on sale at Best Buy, but lucked into a good priceGreen : Not much heat coming out of the uppermost exhaust ventsMy end result:  A great buy.  YES, a thumbs "UP" !  After owning a SONY HD tv, and experienced their lack of customer attention/satisfaction... a  lack of callback on their part force me to forever part with them as a trusted manufacturer.  In my opinion, their (SONY) trusted name is forever trashed/overpriced... if they will not  service what they sell... I want no part of them !

Reviews.Title: I love this tv!
Reviews.Author: polluxcastor
Reviews.Content: I'm watching baseball on the LN40B530 as I write this, and am blown away by the crisp picture and wonderful colors.  The sound is fine as far as my family is concerned.  I did make some adjustments to the equalizer, which improved how it sounded right out of the box.  I walked past the "tv wall" at a local Best Buy, and to me this TV looked as good as the ones in the $2,000-and-up range.  As far as its being "only" 60hz, it looked better than some of the 120hz ones.  Maybe if you're a heavy gamer that's an important consideration, but nobody here is.  Our previous TV was a Hitachi plasma EDTV that we thought was great, but this is a big improvement.  Can't wait to see a blue-ray disc on it.  I wonder if the previous reviewer had a defective one.  None of their complaints are true of this unit at all.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD!!
Reviews.Author: Trent M.
Reviews.Content: I this is my 2nd LCD and the picture quality is amazing!  With 60,000:1 contrast ratio, the colors just POP and make everything look realistic. Standard definition picture quality is good(i.e. standard cable), but HD quality is amazing.  My last set was a philips and the colors on people's faces didn't quite look realistic but this samsung, everything looks realistic.  The picture settings out of the box are pretty good but with a little adjustment(you can find calibration settings online) the PQ is amazing.  The only compliant I have with this TV is the sound which is more than acceptable though.

Reviews.Title: Happy camper
Reviews.Author: Michael L. Fondren
Reviews.Content: I just purchased a Samsung flat sccreen 1080 model LN40B530 40" this set is an excellent buy for its price range. i am happy with its picture and sound. I have it connected to and old Kenwood surround system and it made it this old system sound like it was new.

Reviews.Title: Very nice LCD for the money
Reviews.Author: J. Buckstead "HTS"
Reviews.Content: Needed a good 1080p LCD without breaking the bank and this one fit the bill...PC powerpoints, Sony PS3 and Blu-Ray discs all look great, and the brightness is good for daytime use in well lit rooms.  I like it!

Reviews.Title: first time lcd tv owner
Reviews.Author: senior citizen
Reviews.Content: This is the first lcd tv I have ever owned.  When I first bought it I was worried about how I would like it after reading some other complaints.  I have owned many tv's and compared to them I can't find anything to say bad about it. I love the picture, sound, and the controls. I might buy another one for another room.

Reviews.Title: Great HD picture and great service from Crutchfield
Reviews.Author: Anthony Depietro
Reviews.Content: First I want to say how impressed I am with Crutchfield.  When I purchased this unit through Amazon I really didn't pay much attention to who the actual seller was since it received the standard free shipping.  I purchased this on a Saturday morning.  With in 2 hours I received a phone call from Crutchfield thanking me for my purchase and explaining how the unit would be shipped, etc.  I was very impressed with this and would absolutely purchase from Crutchfield in the future.As for the Samsung - The picture is great with HD.  I got it primarily for sports and the HD channels look great.  Some of the standard def channels are not so spectacular but I don't necessarily think that is a fault of the Samsung, I think it is more a Directv issue.  I have an issue giving anything 5 stars but if you are looking for an LCD in this size range you should take a look at this one.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40 inch 1080p LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: Julie M. Sousa
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. The only thing that I found disappointing is the particular model I purchased did not come with the side inputs for hooking up my digital camera or camcorder etc. Getting to the back of the TV is an inconvenience and it also results in less input options.It's my first flat screen so I wasn't aware that this would be an issue.

Reviews.Title: Smokin' - literally!
Reviews.Author: Family of 4
Reviews.Content: TV was purchased less than 6 months ago. Was a "secondary" TV and was probably used a total of less than 50-75 hours. Yesterday morning started smelling a nasty electrical fire kind of a smell. TV was still working while I ran around trying to figure out where the smell was originating. In those few minutes the whole house got filled with this nasty smoke. Figured out it was the TV and unplugged it. Plugged the TV in again just to check in the evening. Great sound, no picture, still stinks. Anybody need a stinky 40' flat screen RADIO?

Reviews.Title: near-perfect tv...
Reviews.Author: fisherKing
Reviews.Content: i just replaced a new 32" samsung with this 40" model, wanted the larger screen size.the picture is excellent (with a little tweaking); clear, sharp, bright.my only regret...this model (unlike the 32") has no headphone out, so i can not use my powered speakers AND control volume/muting.the internal speakers are, as usual, the weak link (again, made better with some serious tweaking).price just went up on this, but worth it. the only gain in the next model up (the 550) is a slighter better contrast ratio, more inputs/outputs, and a red color on the bezel.if you want a reasonably-priced 40" with a great picture, this is it...

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Purchase!
Reviews.Author: K. Richardson
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for about a month now and it's great.  It has superb clarity and the colors are vibrant.  Definitely on par with or better than Sony and LG, especially for the price.  My only negative comment is the sound.  Maybe I'm going deaf or my space is too large, but I have to turn the volume up much higher than I'm used to...I've added my Bose speakers out of fear of busting the tv's.  Overall, great tv!

Reviews.Title: Samsung is still #1
Reviews.Author: Chilly Cash
Reviews.Content: I work at Bestbuy so I asked everyone I knew there what is the best brand for a television. 100% agreed that Samsung is the A+ brand. TV's aren't cheap, so if I'm gonna spend all this money, I want the best and that's Samsung. The tv arrived with the stand already built, so that was nice. Then after attaching the tv to the stand I got set-up with adding my new blu-ray player and HD DVR with two HDMI cables. This is the best picture quality every!!! There is no way I could be happier, I love this TV!

Reviews.Title: great at first
Reviews.Author: T. Small "techy"
Reviews.Content: Unit worked properly and had good picture for about 3 weeks then started failing with intermittent video, been in shop 3 weeks waiting for the back and forth between samsung and local repair shop, (supposed to be fixed in the next week) we bought samsung for reliability, A bit dissapointed

Reviews.Title: all around winner.
Reviews.Author: zTV
Reviews.Content: Great tv.  great price for what you get. Picture is fantastic - colors crisp and bright, definition is sharp for all colors/shades.  I have direcTV HD.  Cant see how much better this picture will get but it definitely will bridge the game for several years. I don't use other built in features like gaming to speak abt them.  Sound is solid. normal viewing is at about 25% of limit. Tones are balanced and clear.  for larger sound i go thru a stereo receiver.  one sound quirk - the auto volume adjustment takes a couple of seconds to kick in; but that's nit-picking.

Reviews.Title: Excellent LCD -Nice Big Picture
Reviews.Author: Exit39
Reviews.Content: Excellent specs on this TV for the money and full 1080P make it a great value for your buck.  The picture quality is superb for an LCD (We also have a larger plasma) and the hookup is extremely easy and idiot proof.I would recommend getting the service contract as you can always cancel it at a later date for a full refund and you will be totally satisfied with your purchase.Samsung is one of the only manufacturers that DOES stand behind its products and comes out to repair it if it fails.  Our 50" plasma had a power failure problem after about 4 months and a service tech came out within 2 days and replaced the damaged curcuit board for free. This was great because Circuit City where we bought the TV was gone!Yet another good reason to purchase this from Sears and get the warranty.By the way I price shopped this TV hard, and Sears was dollar for dollar against everyone else!

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: D. M. Daniels
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv to replace a 22" Vizio, it is my second HDTV. I just want to say that this TV has risen to all my needs. While it is only 60hz, the motion blur is not terribly visible. The screen has great color and the contrast is just incredible. I used a calibration disk on it and it looks awesome.If you are looking for a great 40" tv for less $, buy this one. It does not disapoint.The only reason I gave this tv 4 stars is because nothing is perfect.

Reviews.Title: rough Start
Reviews.Author: M. huggins "dog walker"
Reviews.Content: After getting the TV set up and figuring out how to use it, we enjoyed 2 nights of watching high def tv, then the screen went dark. The company I was directed to for service could not come for a week. We decided to haul it ourselves to another authorized service center. We had to pick it up and then set it up again. It was a bit discouraging, hope it's not the beginning of a trend. It looks great....for today...

Reviews.Title: I'm Loving It
Reviews.Author: A. L. Randall
Reviews.Content: The value is remarkable I love this. I'm very happy about that since I spent days and hours researching different TV's before my purchase.

Reviews.Title: great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Cameron J. Long
Reviews.Content: This is a very good tv for the price i was upgrading from a 27 inch insignia so this was obviously a great upgrade! Haven't gotten hd programming yet but tv still looks amazing. Must buy for gamers too i have a xbox 360 and it looks insane on this overall very satisfied samsung has not and did not dissapoint me with this tv!

Reviews.Title: Pleased!
Reviews.Author: S. Allen
Reviews.Content: Our first big screen purchase and we are quite pleased.  The quality is excellent and the set up was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: Viewing at it's best
Reviews.Author: Mary E. Nagel "JamokeeGeorgia"
Reviews.Content: After much research and comparison shopping with many models we chose the Samsung. It may have been just a tad more expensive then a few other brands but we felt confident with the reviews and features. We are not sorry. It is a very nice TV. A friend bought the Sony Bravia 40" and we thought it was a bit more user friendly but the Samsung has measured up everywhere else. Amazon was great to deal with, they offered a better price then Walmart. They also had free shipping and the deliverer even unpacked it, set it up, and made sure it was working properly. That was a real plus and much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: LCD HDTV
Reviews.Author: rollon
Reviews.Content: No surprises - product exactly as advertised and expected.  Shipped on time and arrived on time.

Reviews.Title: Great LCD (especially for a bright room)
Reviews.Author: O "O"
Reviews.Content: This TV has been wonderful.  When I compared in the stores, I saw little difference between the latest models with the most advanced numbers and this model that's a couple years older. The one difference I did notice was price: this TV is worth the money.Most of the pros and cons of the TV are listed already here, but one thing to emphasize for folks buying this TV for a bright room is that it has essentially no glare or reflection.  The picture is great even on the sunniest of days.  Very happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: HAPPY CUSTOMER
Reviews.Author: Margaux Paschke
Reviews.Content: This is out third LCD tv from Samsung that we ordered and we are very happy with it.  We love the sleek black design and easy to swivel stand.  Putting it together was a breeze and it was working within 10 minutes.We have a set in Samsung's Touch of Red line which has a constant blue light under the center of the tv that could be annoying - this set has the same blue light when it first turns on and off and that's it. Yeah.  This tv has a swivel stand with fluid movement and works great!  I can now watch tv from the kitchen with just a slight push to get the perfect angle for viewing.  The picture is super crisp and clear with the HD cable box provided at an extra cost by my cable provider and great viewing even without the HD cable service.We considered a Vizio based on great reviews, cheap prices and it being touted as the #1 seller of flat screens but found that the quality was not as good.  I also like the amount of control Samsung provides over the tv settings.  Another huge plus is the Samsung service, they stand behind their brand and their customer service is outstanding.  I love getting a live person to help with any issue or questions.  I dare you to find that with other brands.The only drawback (and lack of five stars) is the tv controller.  This tv controller does not work as well as I would like: it needs to be pointed directly at the bottom right of my tv (the infra red spot) in order for it to work properly and you need to really press down on the buttons for it to work.  Yuck!  I think they went a little too cheap on the controller.

Reviews.Title: 40" Samsung LCDTV 1080p
Reviews.Author: Richard H. Stevens
Reviews.Content: The product was received on schedule with no problems.  Installation was easy and the results were terrific.  I love the quality of the HD programs.  This is my second Samsung the first being a 26" LCDTV.  Both are great sets.

Reviews.Title: Best Buy For Under a Grand
Reviews.Author: Langdon M. Chapman "Bull"
Reviews.Content: Bought this T.V. for our Media Room, and must say was very impressed from the start. It was light weight which made ease for hanging on the wall mount. Then came the picture, WOW super bright colors and excellent clarity. The only draw back are the speakers, they are mediocre at best but that was not important as I used a surround sound system in place. The remote control is small yet very functional and has a good feel. Would definitely recommend this product to anyone.Willis, TX.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40" LCD HDTV, LN40B530
Reviews.Author: Leif R. Montin
Reviews.Content: We are extremely pleased with this purchase.Could not believe that HD would be that much difference from our earlier 27" Toshiba Flat Screen TVThe picture is just perfect and its a real pleasure to watch TV as it is like going to the movies.

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: Stanley A. Best
Reviews.Content: Reception is great, and the picture is beautiful.  I am really pleased with this TV.

Reviews.Title: TV stopped working after less than five months
Reviews.Author: DoJo.Johnson
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with the quality of the picture when we first got the TV. I think this is why this model gets such great reviews - people tend to write them right after they get the product. However, our TV stopped working after less than five months. Upon researching the issue, it turns out that it is very common for this brand to have defective capacitors in their TVs. Some older models have been recalled in the past because of this defect. So common in fact, that the service agency we called did not even ask for specifics about what happened. Rather, they left a message on our phone stating "we will call you as soon as we get the part". Anyway, we are hoping to have it fixed under warranty but it sounds like many people have had to pay $500 or more to have this part replaced. My advice is - do not buy this TV unless you do some research first - google the terms "Samsung" and "capacitor" before you make a decision and spend your money.

Reviews.Title: Non expert review
Reviews.Author: M. Sullivan "Book Reviews"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the LN40B530 and received it yesterday.  I currently do not game or the set so I can not talk about that. From an HDTV TV perspective it is an incredible set.  The picture is fantastic.  The setup was easy I did not need another person as the instructions suggested.  It was nice that the stand is built for you.  The instructions stated I had to assembly the stand as well.I was originally going to purchase an LG 37HLH30.  I went to a local retail to look at the set.  There was a dramatic difference betwen this and the other 1080 sets.  The Samsung was the best the colors were better than the others.  BTW if you are looking at the 37HLH30 go with the 37HLH40 the colors are much better with the H40. The other set I saw at the store was the Sony KDL40S5100.  All 3 of the final sets LG 37HLH40, Sony KDL40S5100 and Samsun LN40B530 had beautiful pictures but side to side Samsung has the best colors. Sony was second and LG third.  The LG had more connections (inputs) but my old set a Sharp Aquous 26 has so many that I never used them all anyway.The only thing that the Samsung did not have was the picture in picture.  But I barely have used this anyway on my Sharpe.After narrowing down my search to these 3 I was going to purchase the Samsung or Sony preferably or the LG if the price was a steal.  In the end I got the Samsung (on Amazon) at $60 less than I could have gotten the other two so I choose it.Overall the picture is unbelievable.  Unless you are aMy suggestion to those researching on the web is to take a look at the TV and it competion in store.  Seeing them side by side on the same image really helps your choice.

Reviews.Title: Did your Samsung fail just out of warranty?
Reviews.Author: Dan0
Reviews.Content: After seeing all the reviews where the Samsung went up in smoke or otherwise died. I did some research and found there is a class action suit covering some of the repairs. Are you covered under the class action lawsuit?Check here to find out[...]Good Luck

Reviews.Title: My first TV that I've been happy with for over 2.5 years
Reviews.Author: Bobby Shornock
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Samsung LN40B Series TV in October 2009 when it retailed at $1,000 and I would seriously pay that for the same TV all over again.The picture is crystal clear, the sound is great even without speakers, menus are easy to navigate and it's easy to switch back and forth between options.  Picture In Picture is also supported with a subscription.The TV is also loaded for bear with ports.4 HDMI(3 in the rear, one on the right side, awesome for moving a PS3, Xbox360, or even connecting a laptop to the TV without having to move cables.2 Composite AV ports1 Y/W/R Component AV port, great for switching the PS3 from 1080p to 480p, since Analog TV's do not recognize themselves on PS3's, unfortunatly, best part is it's also on the side)2 USB Ports on the side, great for watching videos and pictures, or even listening to music from the TV.2 Stereo Outputs1 Digital Audio Link1 PC Port1 LAN port(For internet features on the TV, or for upgrading the firmware)If I ever had the desire to buy another TV, it would be exactly the same model in 3D, now every monitor I buy, computer or TV, is Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Arguably one of the best LCD HDTVs
Reviews.Author: Mark Lorenz "kewl!o"
Reviews.Content: Samsung has always had quality products, this TV included.  If you are looking for a TV that works well and looks great, look no further. I and my daughter have had Samsungs for years with literally no issues.If you do your homework, you'll find that for LCDs this TV is a good choice.  For plasma, I recommend Panasonic Viera (e.g. 50").Going forward, if you have the money, I'd get an LED - they are thinner, lighter, better picture, and cheaper to run.

Reviews.Title: bad capacitors buyer beware!!
Reviews.Author: yvonne from PA
Reviews.Content: Had product for 4 years, slowly the picture kept going out for the last month and a half until a week ago it finally went. I did research on the innernet and many, many other consumers had the same issue. They all said it is the capacitor, half the consumers did not have sound or picture but the other half had the same issue as I did, no picture but, had sound. The reviews also said that even though it's been a big issue if you are not under the warranty you are out of luck.They also, have a video on you tube on how to fix it, so that is what we will attempt to do since I called the company and I was also told that it is not under warranty and that I will have to fix it out of my own pocket. Even after I told the lady that this is an issue that many, many others have had.She just gave me a number for a repair place near me and I called, they want 99.00 an hour for labor!! Called another place 75.00 an hour! I would not have an issue with this if it was something that was some what common, but this is tooooo common. So BUYER BEWARE!! You can do your search on the net and you will see! Do not make a mistake like us, save your money!

Reviews.Title: great after a year and a 600 mile move!
Reviews.Author: Caro
Reviews.Content: Absolutely no complaints about this TV.  Picture and sound are great, and it held up through a 600 mile U-Haul moving trip (wrapped in many blankets, of course).  I got a great deal on this and I couldn't be happier with it.

Reviews.Title: A Good Quality Television
Reviews.Author: Holly Lauber
Reviews.Content: Samsung is a great company that makes great quality products whether it's a cell phone or a large television. The LN40B530 is a great television. I see crisp, quality details on my regular television shows along with sports. I do not see any blurriness when there are action scense which is always a bonus! The HD quality is amazing on this television, with the right cable company. I have Direct TV and it's good quality, but not the best reception. My sister has Direct TV with excellent recption and their HD is wonderful! I would expect HD quality will be great with basic cable as you don't have to worry about reception.There are plenty of places to hook up your DVR's, DVD players, game systems, and computers on the back of this television! I only wish I knew what to do with all of those ports! The settings are also easy to figure out and you can adjust your television to your liking. Set up is super easy as well.This TV is light enough to move around by yourself as long as you aren't short. On it's stand I can move it around but if I were going to pick it up, or mount it on the wall I would need help.The sound on this television isn't the best. It could be a cable/satellite issue though. I do find that on some stations I have to turn the volume way up to hear it across the room. If you want BIG sound you will need to hook it up to some speakers or a surround sound system. The other problem I have had is that I have a red spot in my pixels. There's really no inexpensive way to fix this (if you even can) and it happend shortly after the warranty was up on the product. I don't always notice it but if it's a dark picture it's noticable.Over all this is a good TV

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: zsmith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV a year ago and it is running great. The picture is excellent. It sounds like one of the internal speakers is starting to crack, but I am getting ready to set up a home theatre system anyway. I recommend this product to anyone looking for great quality at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG LCD, NEED I SAY MORE???? THUMBS UP
Reviews.Author: ATL_TONY
Reviews.Content: This is the second Samsung LCD TV that I have purchased from Amazon vendor themselves and from ordering, shipping, arrival there has never been a hiccup.I previous had the Samsung LN46A550 so this was a bit smaller being a LN40B530 but nothing else compromised!The brightest from Samsung LCD TVs is unbelievable. Combo-ing this with my PS3 blu-ray and HD from DirectTV I couldn't ask for a better TV. I'm about 6 months late in reviewing this product so please bare with me on pricing. I purchased this TV for ~$650.xx shipped which was a great deal.Nowadays, you can find the same manufacturer and price but in a 42 and if you're lucky and patience, even a 46 inch! Really goes to show you how smart shopping and patience and save you a boatload.I use this TV for my room and it's the perfect size. My room size is 12 x 14 so anything bigger would be stupid.The TV has 3 HDMI ports which was enough for me: (1) for HD DIRECT TV, (1) for PS3, and (1) for HDMI output from my computer. Honestly I don't know why someone need that many more HDMI ports but even if they did, they have HDMI hubs for that which make switching among devices even quicker.Sound is great for an LCD TV, good amount but I have mine hooked up to some 40 series  Polk bookshelf speakers and a Polk subwoofer. Talk about a theater experience in your own bedroom.Overall, if you can find this TV for ~600 shipped brand new, call it a steal! But like I mentioned above, for that price nowadays, you can find a 42 inch easily and possible a 46 inch even.

Reviews.Title: Plain awesome, excellent bang for your buck!!
Reviews.Author: gp19
Reviews.Content: This TV is just awesome and I love every aspect of it.First of all, the exterior design is dark, sleek and really attractive, it mainly continues with the line of Samsung designs we've grown to love.The TV isn't heavy at all so it's easy to move around and set up, be it the normal stand or the wall mount.The image will blow your mind. It's just as awesome as it comes. The 60,000:1 aspect ratio gives a pretty nice black-to-white transference and the brightness is really good too. The colors are really vivid and really make the images stand out.I have an xbox360 and a PS3 hooked up to it and the gaming experience is just mind blowing. The blu-rays on this thing are just breath-taking, the image is really sharp and clear and brightness and color depth will really amaze you.Many people have critisized the built-in speakers, but I think the sound is really good and clear. I also have it hooked to a 5.1 home theater system, but the built-in sound is not bad at all.The price is excellent IMO, I paid U$705.00 and it arrived in perfect conditions.Overall I think this item is a great buy. An excellent TV for a very good price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Matte Screen is Key
Reviews.Author: Meathead 71
Reviews.Content: I also have a Samsung 58PN560 to compare to, so.....The color is great out of the box, whereas i fiddled with the plasma a lot more.The matte screen does a great job of limiting reflections in a sunny room with a big picture window.  I don't know if they make many models any more with a matte screen, but I would highly recommend it.Watched half of the superbowl on the TV and noticed no streaking or blurring of motion of any kind.Only thing I can't seem to find on this TV is how to set the time - not sure if it is a feature or not.  Don't really need the instructions to get up and running.Sound is better than on last tv...36" Toshiba - picture tube and all...probably 175 lbs.

Reviews.Title: quite happy with tv so far
Reviews.Author: T. Dean
Reviews.Content: had this tv for about a month now. we don't have cable so it is mainly used for watching movies and playing video games. i am very happy with the colors and the picture is tight. movies and 360 games look great on it. i would buy this tv again, samsung almost always makes a quality product. also, product was delivered via pilot freight services. this was my first experience with them and i read mixed reviews. i had no problems with the delivery. the delivery truck arrived when they said it would and they called about a half hour before arrival to make sure i was home.

Reviews.Title: Quality 2nd TV
Reviews.Author: OMP
Reviews.Content: I picked up this TV for my bedroom, so it is not my primary TV.  I have only had it a month, but all is well.  Very clear picture for HD channels and surprisingly good picture on the non-HD channels.  I also like the feature that automatically spreads non-HD channels across the entire TV vs. having the black bars on the side.  Definitely a good price for quality TV.  Hopefully it will hold up for the long haul, but given that it is a Samsung, my guess is that it should hold up (hopefully I didn't just jinx myself).

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: J. Everitt
Reviews.Content: This is our first LCD TV and we are very pleased.  Love how it looks on my wall and the picture quality is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Outdoor "Sportsman J"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this for my in-laws for Christmas and it arrived in plenty of time. It was very easy to set up and program and easily connected to their DVD player and satellite box. This set has good quality sound and is very responsive and has a clear and crisp picture. Control menus and picture adjustments are intuitive with on-screen icons that can easily be followed to get where you want to be. The remote control is easy to see and easy to use even for those more mature in age. We were able to teach my in-laws how to change channels, switch between antenna and satellite, and adjust the picture in under 15 minutes. This is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Garrett Ebersole
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Samsung LCD TV in December of 2009 and have enjoyed it immensely.  This was my first LCD Tv, and my first HDTV.  I waited a very long time to finally get one at the price I wanted and as such, my review is probably tainted by HD being newish to me.Anyways, the tv is wonderful.  It works well in my living room, which has a lot of windows and is very bright.  The black levels on the tv are about what I expected out of a standard LCD (ie, not LED).  There is some motion blurring during sports, but I can only notice this when sitting too close.  This tv is a great buy for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: A. Archie "I'm kinda a big deal"
Reviews.Content: Honestly I was pretty skeptical about purchasing this television based on a few of the reviews.  Overall the reviews were great but specifically one of the reviewers mentioned a power switch problem that he suggested was chronic for this make.  I decided to purchase the TV anyway because I have a larger Samsung (plasma) TV that has held up beautifully and I figured for the price I'd take the chance.  So far it has not let me down.This TV has a great picture and decent sound that delivers a wonderful overall experience.  1080p makes everything come to life.I'm giving this TV a 5 star not because I think it's the absolute best TV on the planet, rather because it has been a wonderful addition that has delivered exceptional quality and performance for a more than reasonable price.All around solid buy!

Reviews.Title: This is the 3rd Samsung flat screen we have purchased
Reviews.Author: Kim D. Deluca "Grandma"
Reviews.Content: Beautiful picture.  We now have 3 Samsung flat screens in our house.  This 40 inch is a little aggressive in size for our bedroom but I could pass up the great pricing and free shipping.  Its like being at the movies from the comfort of our bed.

Reviews.Title: great tv for teenages
Reviews.Author: Irene Dansby "value shopper"
Reviews.Content: My grandaughters love the tv for their teenage hangout. An upgrade would have been better with their WII and Play Station but it is great for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great, affordable television
Reviews.Author: L. Cochran
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this purchase.  I got it for a fantastic price.  While there are models with better specs out there, this was an affordable option.  I have not noticed any issues with picture.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Converted Fan of HDTV
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize how archaic the picture on my old TV was until I purchased this Samsung HD.  The picture quality is amazing with a standard over the air TV signal. I would highly recommend this product to others.

Reviews.Title: Wow! What a buy this was!
Reviews.Author: rosiedarivetor "Rosie"
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Samsung LN40B530 HDTV as a family Christmas present.  We had checked this particular HDTV out locally by comparing its picture and features. It far outshined the others.  Our final decision was to purchase it from Amazon as Amazon had the best price around and we were already familiar with Amazon's fine shipping procedures.We are very impressed, experiencing no problems AT ALL!

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: J. Harrell "Chuck"
Reviews.Content: really good...got this for $650, can't beat that. Picture and sound are great. Only issue is minimal A/V inputs.  Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Smokin' Hot Deal - Samsung LN40B530
Reviews.Author: B. Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on a smokin' hot deal from the Brick (buyer beware the Brick do not always allow returns) as we had a credit on account and needed to use it up we went ahead and purchased from the Brick.  The Samsung LN40B530 is a second TV that goes in our bedroom.  It was easy to hookup.  I only had a cable box and a DVD player to plug in, both are HDMI so it was a snap.I replaced the remote with a Sony Universal Remote which replaces the 3 remotes to run everything else.  I love the Sound Mode, SRS, Picture Size and Picture Mode buttons on the remote and programed them onto the Universal Remote.  P.MODE button changes the Picture Quality (PQ) in an instance, I love this feature as you can rotate through the different choices as quick as you can click your remote, the same is true of the other 3 buttons mentioned.The picture is fantastic.  My wife was amazed with the PQ.  I have viewed the Samsung LN40B530 against other TVs with faster refresh rates and higher priced at the different box stores.  Personally I feel the PQ is as good as other higher priced TVs with the faster refresh rates.  If you are price concise, this TV is to be considered.  One of the first things I noticed when I started watching this TV was the clarity and vibrant colors.  I remember in the first day or two of getting the TV, I was watching a show, I don't remember which one it was, but I remember thinking, look at the hair on the arms of that girl, that is how good the clarity is on this TV.  The PQ is awesome.  I love the rich vibrant colors.One negative item, when ever I see a label of HD on a program, I assume it is 1080 however the signal may only be 720 or less.  On my Sony all I have to do to check this out is hit my info button on the TV remote and it would display 1080 or 720 or whatever it may be, however with the Samsung it always shows 1080 even when watching non HD programs.  I have scanned the manual and haven't yet found where the correct info can be displayed.  Personally if the PQ is not 1080 I would rather watch something else that is 1080.If you can not differentiate the PQ of this TV from that of other TVs with faster refresh rates or if you watch little or no sports, don't be taken in with all the hype of the faster refresh rates and buy this TV and you will do yourself a favour and save yourself $100s of dollars.

Reviews.Title: Another great Samsung product
Reviews.Author: Dean J. Middleton
Reviews.Content: Had a 44" version of this in our old house and left in when we moved. Bought thisto g in our slightly smaller living room in our new house and love it. Sound quality isn't perfect but great for the price. Also bought matching DVD player for $69.99 and the are simple plug and play with HDMI cable. One remote does it all!

Reviews.Title: Samsung
Reviews.Author: Adam D. Wilson
Reviews.Content: Looks fine at 60 Hertz on FIOS.  Not enough inputs for main household tv or for a gamer.  I am using it in a family room with just a cable box and a blue ray player so it works great for me.

Reviews.Title: BROKE JUST OUT OF WARRENTY
Reviews.Author: Michelle C "Michelle"
Reviews.Content: Caution!  Do not buy Samsung.  I bought a 40inch LCD, and it broke just over a year after purchase. Samsung knows the issue.  They all have this same problem.  The authorize service repair person charges 230 to replace the part.  They also say  "samsung is aware of this faulty part but does not replace them or change the way they make the TV."  Happily the service person stated "I fix this same problem all the time."  Samsung will not extend the warranty for this part.  The part tends to break just after a year.  The picture was great, but expect it to break in a year.Look it up online-the complaint is all over.  TV chimes on and off but will not turn on.

Reviews.Title: TV has Easy to break Screen - Protect from Kids and Wii remotes
Reviews.Author: Fred Toth
Reviews.Content: PARENTS that buy this TV - For families with small Kids like ours you can protect the FRAGILE SCREEN  from flying toys and fingerprints with easy to install, heavy duty  TV-ProtectorTM Special Design TV Screen Protector that fits 40 inch LCD, LED and Plasma TVs also works to deflect Nintendo Wii remotes. At $149 is worth the investment.Eliminate all worries and ------- Enjoy ----- your TV.

Reviews.Title: Power Supply Problems - No Authorized Service
Reviews.Author: L.H. "Lynn"
Reviews.Content: I purchased two TVs in the LN series just over two years ago. The power supply has gone on one of them which I hear is a common problem. They gave me the phone number for authorized service but I can't get a return call. Maybe too many problems that are being fixed?

Reviews.Title: Great TV for $664 taxes included
Reviews.Author: D. Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: This is a great tv for a bedroom, sound isnt that great but for that price u cant go wrong. picture is ok also, one thing I did notice is that tvs always come with that info sticker on the side of the tv letting u know all the spec's it has, my tv didnt come with that sticker. I dont think its a big deal everything looks new. Over all its a great tv for a really good price. If anyone else was missing the info sticker please comment back just wanna make sure I got a new set.

Reviews.Title: First LCD TV and I love it.
Reviews.Author: Misoluv
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time looking at TV's in the 40" range and love this one so far. It's only been a month but I can't say enough about the picture quality. I debated for a while about it being 120Hz and am glad I didn't pay more for 240Hz. I haven't done a side by side comparison, but this one works great for me.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tv for ANYONE!
Reviews.Author: Mona Lisa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have the LN52A650 (bought from Amazon in Dec. 08) so when my husband's 87 yr. old uncle decided to upgrade his old crt to hi-def, he called me to start the search for him and get one ordered and delivered.He already knew he wanted a Samsung ("I just hear they're the best" he says), nothing over 32". I had a hard time convincing him that he needed more than a 32" so getting him to agree to a 40" was quite a challenge. He sits at least 12' from the tv and can afford ANY tv he wants. All that was left was to decide on which model would be right for him.After we decided on this model, the rest was up to Amazon and they didn't disappoint! Pilot freight delivered our LN52A650 set and they delivered this one to our Uncle. He lives about 50 miles from us so we wanted to be sure his delivery was truly "white glove". Some retailers say white glove when all they offer is to bring it inside and set it down in the room of your choice. Pilot unpacks it, plugs it in, puts batteries in the remote, powers it on and takes away the box.Our uncle had Charter arrive the same afternoon to hook up his new HD DVR. He is very impressed with the picture. But he is so completely non-tech oriented that we were amazed he even wanted an HDTV. Now if we can just talk him into actually USING the pause and record features of his dvr, he'll be all set! When he first got his cell phone, he would NOT turn it on. No one could call him on it. It took us months to convince him that he was NOT being charged airtime for just turning his cell phone on! What a character!

Reviews.Title: Not enough inputs
Reviews.Author: Robert Lodge
Reviews.Content: We bought this LCD just for watching TV on in the bedroom (gonna mount it on the wall), but it's now in the family room until we get our big TV. Everything about this set is fantastic, except for the lack of inputs. The sound was seriously lacking at first, but I just went to the Equalizer settings and moved the sliders from the middle over to the right a bit and now it's plenty loud.About the inputs: If you have a lot of older equipment, like this cheapskate, then you're going to run out. I have a 75 ohm digital TV antenna input, a composite, or AV,S-Video, or 75 ohm input from an FTA system, another composite (or AV) from the DVD, and the AV from the VCR. I also play tapes and slide shows from the DVR and digital cameras, which require AV or S-Video inputs.Well, this TV only has the HDMI inputs (3, I think), one set of composite, one set of AV, and that's it. There are no side or front inputs for a camera, and no S-Video jack. None of my boxes will let the digital TV  pass through and be picked up by the TV, so everything needs its own cable and jack. All those HDMI inputs don't do me any good, since only the DVD has a jack, and I'm not about to spend $20 for an HDMI cable just to use for a week or two. Of course I'll be spending probably $200 on cables when I finally get my big screen, so I'm being super cheap here.So I highly recommend this set for anyone that doesn't have a bunch of old stuff to connect. The picture is superb, the sound is great, the remote is easy to figure out, and the menu system is good enough. The instruction booklet is a joke, there are 2 pages of everything because of all the different models, but it does have a nice index if you need specific info.Oh, one more thing. Ordering from Amazon was great, and Pilot shipping rocks. Good communication, right on time, and the driver unpacked the TV so we could plug it in and verify it wasn't damaged or DOA. Unless we find an incredible deal locally (not likely), we will order our big screen from Amazon too.

Reviews.Title: great tv for the price
Reviews.Author: rex scates
Reviews.Content: Whne calibrated this TV's data revivals TV's twice its price in this size range.if you dotn calibrate the tv use the movie setting as its the clesest to what it should be.can't go wrong getting this and I have not seen any motion artifacts with this tv.-rex scates

Reviews.Title: Don't Purchase Samsung LCD TV's
Reviews.Author: Desert Rat "Mike"
Reviews.Content: Bought a Samsung 40" LCD TV 2 1/2 years ago based on high ratings from all types of groups.  Now the TV turns on and off 8-10 times before getting a real picture and has multi-colored lines in it.Off Warranty says Samsung - call a service person.  Called 2 of the ones Samsung recommended - service tech said problem is bad power panel(s) from defective manufactured parts; depending on the number of panels - repair cost is $275-$650.Said they have seen this problem from a number of Samsung LCD TV's this age.  Contacted Samsung - nothing - no care, concern, no response to acknowledging the defects or any action to making the problem right.Save yourself the headaches - DO NOT BUY SAMSUNG PRODUCTS - but a Sony, Vizio or LG - you'll be better off and no frustrations in a couple of years.  Samsung has ZERO customer service.

Reviews.Title: dissapointed
Reviews.Author: jake
Reviews.Content: i guess my other samsung must be 120mhz cause the picture is not nearly as good as my two year old samsung. wonder if i can return this for a better model? I mean,it pic is ok but not even close to my 46 samsung from two years ago. i just assumed any new model would be better.

Reviews.Title: Not A Good TV
Reviews.Author: D. Cunningham
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this model and am wildly disappointed. The viewing angle is awful, the colors are bleeding together, and the picture while playing a DVD is beyond horrendous. I'll be returning my set soon - I recommend you don't even bother.
